help.message:
* `?tags reload` to reload the tags
* `?[tag]` to use a tag
* `?help` to show this command
* `?tags list` to list all tags

proxy.message: To use a proxy, refer to this: <https://github.com/PrismarineJS/mineflayer/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md#how-can-i-use-a-socks5-proxy>

sharecode.message:
Give me your code! It will be easier for the both of us, and will make debugging way easier. 
Please **use <https://privatebin.net/>, <https://gist.github.com/>, or <https://hastebin.com/> **

cb.message:
Use codeblocks for formatting code:
\`\`\`js
<your code here>
\`\`\`

Produces:
```js
if (true) {
  console.log('Hello World!')
}
```

does not work.message:
Against popular belief "does not work" is not sufficient information to provide to receive help.
What's the expected (wanted) behaviour, what's the actual (unwanted) behaviour? Do you get any errors? What's your relevant code that might be causing the issue?

click.message:
All of the following assumes that you have already opened the desired window.
To click on an item in a window use: `bot.clickWindow(<slot>, <mouse_button>, <mode>)`

This will return a `Promise` of type `void`, which means it can be awaited.
`<slot>` is the `item.slot` of the item you want to click on in the window.
`<mouse_button>` is `0` for left click, and `1` for right click.
`<mode>` is the mode of the click, mineflayer only supports `1` for this.
To get more info:
<https://github.com/PrismarineJS/mineflayer/blob/master/docs/api.md#botclickwindowslot-mousebutton-mode-cb>
